p: Finally, Oropouche virus (OROV) is an under-reported etiologic agent of AFI, which causes symptoms similar to those of dengue and has been detected in mixed outbreaks of dengue in Madre de Dios (Peru) [ 16]. In 2011, a study in Iquitos, located in the Peruvian Amazon, reported that OROV was responsible for 14.9% of acute febrile infections [ 17]. Additionally, in January 2016, a study from Madre de Dios in Peru, analyzed samples that were previously negative for DENV and found OROV in 24% of cases; to date, this result has been the most significant OROV outbreak in Peru with 120 confirmed cases [ 18]. Due of these outbreaks, OROV has been identified as a potential cause for epidemics and co-infections and the WHO has advised Peru to focus on preventive measures for vector control and surveillance [ 16].
